column4: Is there any docs on the differences / benefits of Ubuntu over Gentoo?
I have been a long time gentoo user. But I am doing a re-install and have head lots of good things about ubuntu
Ah I see
I read that it is based on debian. I used debian a few years ago but the package management (mainly dealing with dependencies) was not very good
you must have used debian a *long* time ago
enlightenment is in the repos, but which version I don't know offhand
a new "stable" every 6 months
Can you update to the next stable via apt-get (or similar) or do you need to install off CD?
you just change sources and do a dist-upgrade
#ubuntu is fairly permissive in general ;)
too much so at times...
reload before installing is advisable
But what about for updates / patches. Do I need to click reload for it to know about them?
yes, unless you use the update manager, which does it automatically
Where do I configure the update manager ?
umm... I'm in fluxbox at the moment so I can't look
ok no problem I will poke around
or type ` sudo update-manager` in a terminal
quicker
Excellent thanks
hahaha
